subject: Hannah Storm: How to Stay Healthy
body:
CBSNews.com



 









  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 



       April 26, 
      2007


Hi, everyone,
 
I hope you've been having a great 
      week. It sure has flown by for me 
      as I'm still getting used to being back from vacation. I don't know 
      how Julie does it all the time, 
      flying back and forth from New York to Los Angeles. 
 
I was in L.A. last week 
      and I am still in a completely different time 
      zone!  Last night I was 
      up until midnight which goes against the advice of Steve Slon, editor of AARP magazine, 
      who 
      told us this morning that in order to keep healthy and ward off 
      illness we need get our sleep. Another tip was to get a pet, which is 
      something that Harry and I can attest to.
 
Speaking of pets, Harry 
      had a great segment this morning on how to pick a puppy and bring him up. Harry 
      was on set with the cutest puppy this morning but what you didn't see 
      was that the puppy shed all 
      over Harry's grey suit. As Harry put it, he "took one for the team."
 
Also this morning, we 
      welcomed our new National Correspondent Jeff Glor, who joins us from Boston. Jeff gave 
      us a behind-the-scenes look at Rosie O'Donnell's surprise 
      announcement Wednesday that she is leaving "The View" after just one year. We all sit around 
      after our own show and watch other television shows and there certainly 
      were many screeches in our newsroom when Rosie made her announcement. 
      While many wonder what Rosie will do now, Jeff pointed out that Rosie 
      not only has Broadway aspirations but will also likely have her own 
      show again in the near 
      future. As for the future of the show, it will be interesting to 
      see how ABC will fill those two open seats. 
 
And, with warm weather 
      just around the corner we chatted with Consumer Correspondent Susan 
      Koeppen about 
      summer safety tips for the kids and new safety devices for home spas. Susan also gave us a 
      easy tip to keep your child safe: 
      open your windows from the top down to prevent them from climbing or falling out. This is something we started doing in my 
      house a long time ago and it is a simple 
      way to keep everyone safe. 
 
Well folks, the week is 
      almost over so hang in there. We'll 
      see you tomorrow when we'll have the 
      latest Survivor castoff and we'll wrap up our Wedding in a Week series with a lovely ceremony 
      for Lisa and Stephen right on our plaza!



Take 
      care,
Hannah 
      Storm EarlyShow@cbs.com
